alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 9:08PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Florence, Darlington and southern Marlboro Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 908 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Mont Clare to near Lee State Park. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hartsville, Darlington, Timmonsville, Lamar, Dovesville, Mont Clare, Lydia, Darlington Raceway, Auburn, Swift Creek, Cartersville, Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus, Mechanicsville, Oats, Floyd, Society Hill and Carolina Pines Regional Medical Center. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 126 and 141. Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 146 and 168. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
